net.sf.opengroove.client.com
Class CommandCommunicator

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.client.com.CommandCommunicator

public class CommandCommunicator
extends Object

This class wraps the Communicator class, and provides methods for doing common interaction tasks with the server.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

setDefaultTimeout

public void setDefaultTimeout(int timeout)

sendImmediateMessage

public String sendImmediateMessage(String id,
                                   String username,
                                   String computer,
                                   byte[] message)
                            throws IOException
Sends an immediate message to the user specified.

Parameters:
id - An id for the imessage. This can be anything that the recipient of the message would be expecting, but cannot be longer than 64 characters.
username - The userid or username of the user to send the message to.
computer - The name of the computer to send the message to
message - The message itself, not longer than 8KB
Returns:
The status of sending the message. If sending the message succeeded, then this would be the string "OK". If sending the message failed, then this is a code that represents the reason for the failure. See the source for OpenGrooveRealmServer for the list of possible error codes.
Throws:
IOException

                    throws IOException

IOException

ping

public void ping()
          throws IOException
Pings the server. This command sends a ping command and waits until it receives a response before returning.

Throws:
IOException

getTime

public long getTime()
             throws IOException
Queries the server for it's current time. The result is the server's time in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 UTC.

Returns:
The server's current time, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 UTC
Throws:
IOException

searchUsers

public UserSearch searchUsers(String searchText,
                              int offset,
                              int limit,
                              boolean searchOtherRealms,
                              String[] userSettings,
                              int timeout)
                       throws IOException
Searches for users.

Parameters:
searchText - The text to search for. If this text is present in either the user's username or one of the user settings specified, and the user is visible, then the user will be included in this list.
offset - The offset to return results from. This can be used to only download a page of search results at a time from the server.
limit - The maximum number of results that will be returned at a time.
searchOtherRealms - true to search other realm servers (in which case the search may be slow), false to only search this realm server. Exactly which other realm servers are searched is up to this user's realm server, but it is typically all servers listed in the public server directory, as well as any additional servers that this user's realm server is configured to search.
userSettings - A list of user settings to search in addition to the user's username. If this is the empty array, only the user's username will be searched.
timeout - The timeout to wait for the results to come back. If it's -1, then the default timeout is used. Generally, the timeout should be higher than that if other realm servers are searched.
Returns:
Throws:
IOException

setVisibility

public void setVisibility(boolean visible)
                   throws IOException
Sets your visibility. When your account is created, this is, by default, false. If this is false, then you won't be returned as part of any searchUsers requests. If this is true, then you can be returned as part of a searchUsers request. Changes to this may take a few minutes (or even longer, the OpenGroove specs specify a maximum prepegation time of 24 hours, although it is generally much shorter than that) to propegate through all of the realm servers, although the change will generally be available to other users on your realm server immediately.

Parameters:
visible - True to make you visible to other users, so that your username can be searched for using the searchUsers command, false to hide your information
Throws:
IOException

getVisibility

public boolean getVisibility()
                      throws IOException
Returns whether or not this user is publicly listed.

Returns:
True if this user is publicly listed, false if not. See setVisibility(boolean) for more info.
Throws:
IOException

getUserStatus

public UserStatus getUserStatus(String username,
                                String computer)
                         throws IOException
Gets the current status of the user specified. If computer is null or the empty string, the resulting user status will reflect all of the user's computers. This means that if any of the computers are online, then isOnline(), when called on the returned object, will return true, and getLastOnline() will return the last online time of the computer that was most recently online.

Parameters:
username - The username of the user to check
computer - The name of the computer to get status for, or the empty string to get the status of all of the user's computers
Returns:
A UserStatus object that reflects the status of the user
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs

getUserSetting

public String getUserSetting(String username,
                             String key)
                      throws IOException
Gets a setting from the user specified. If the username is null or the empty string, then the setting is for this user, and the key can be anything. If the username is not null or the empty string, then key can only start with public- .

Parameters:
username - The username of the user to get the setting for, or null or the empty string for this user
key - The key of the property to get, which must only start with public- unless the username specified is null or the empty string
Returns:
The value of the user setting specified
Throws:
IOException

listUserSettings

public String[] listUserSettings(String username)
                          throws IOException
Lists the settings for the user specified. If the username is null or the empty string, then all properties for this user will be returned. If the username is not null or the empty string, then only properties that begin with public- and are for the user specified will be returned.

Parameters:
username - The name of the user to get properties for, or null or the empty string for this user
Returns:
The list of user properties for the user specified, which will all start with public- unless the username is null or the empty string
Throws:
IOException

                    throws IOException

Parameters:

value - The value that the user setting is to have

deleteComputer

public void deleteComputer(String computer)
                    throws IOException
deletes the computer specified. This deletes all of the computer's data, so care should be taken when running this method.

The server usually batches up tasks related to deleting a computer, so it may take anywhere from a few minutes to an hour or more for resources related to the computer (such as pending workspace items or message cache space) to be reclaimed. The only guarantee about this method is that calls to listComputers by this user that happen after this method is called will not return this computer.

Due to the fact that the server usually batches up tasks related to deleting a computer, a new computer with the same name as an old one should not be created for at least 24 hours after the old one was deleted. Otherwise, the new computer, or some of it's data, could be sporadically delete.

Parameters:
computer - The name of the computer to delete.
Throws:
IOException

parseDateString

public static long parseDateString(String dateString)
Parses the specified date string, in the format returned by the OpenGroove Realm Server, into a long representing the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970. The standard date format in the server protocol is the number of milliseconds since january 1, 1970, a space, and the text-readable date in the format returned by Date.toString()

Parameters:
dateString - The string representing the date to parse
Returns:
a long indicating the value of the date specified

Formats the specified long into a date that the server can recognize.

Parameters:
date -
Returns:
